content: for pattern support just pm me 3 medium & large trees the medium and large tree follow similar instructions with the addition of a few more rounds for the large tree marked in pattern you will also use different needle sizes using your main tree color cast on 8 sts divide the sts over 2 dpns with 4 sts on each needle and join to work in the round round 1 knit round 2 kfb repeat till end 16 sts redistribute the sts onto 3 dpns needle 1 now has 4 sts and needle 2 and 3 now have 6 sts each round 3 7 knit add 2 more rounds for large tree medium = 5 rounds large = 7 rounds round 8 k1 kfb repeat till end 24 sts round 9-13 knit add 2 more rounds for large tree round 14 k2 kfb repeat until end 32 sts round 15-19 knit add 2 more rounds for large tree round 20 k3 kfb repeat until end 40 sts round 21-25 knit add 2 more round for large tree round 26 k4 kfb repeat until end 48 sts round 27 knit round 28 ssk k4 repeat until end 40 sts round 29 ssk k3 repeat until end 32 sts round 30 ssk k2 repeat until end 24 sts round 31 ssk k1 repeat until end 16 sts change to trunk color round 32-41 knit round 42 purl round 24 knit cast off cut yarn tidy up hole while weaving in end do not shut up bottom hole as it remains open finishing photos pg 2 embroidery step 1 candles put a long piece of white colored yarn on your tapestry needle enter your needle under the trunk and come out where you want your first candle to go make your candles about 3 sts high be careful not to stitch the 2 sides together as it will be harder to stuff later my candles are positioned like a pyramid with the longest row at the bottom you may want to secure your last candle in place with a small stitch step 2 flames put a long piece of flame colored yarn on your tapestry needle enter your needle under the trunk and come out at the top of your first candle my flames are done in chain stitch lazy daisy petals i make my flames 1 st high once you have secured your flame in place move your needle to where you want your next flame to go step 3 wreath stitch horizontal green lines under your candles following the same process as your candles stuffing make sure all ends are stuffed up in your tree stuff your tree firmly bottom remains open so they can stand better independently thanks for knitting one of my designs for pattern support just pm me 4
